intro: Satureja serpyllifolia, commonly known as creeping sage, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically has small, oval-shaped leaves with a grayish-green hue and produces tiny, pale blue or purple flowers. Its aromatic properties are due to the presence of essential oils, which contribute to its use in traditional medicine and culinary applications. Satureja serpyllifolia thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats.
